intro: Declieuxia chiococcoides var. linearis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and along waterways. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
